Sentece: In conscious sodium replete sheep with a parotid fistula, infusion of CBX (40 mg/h for 10 days) did not increase mean arterial pressure, or change sodium and potassium status or plasma renin concentration, but significantly increased the half-life of 1,2[3H] cortisol from 18.6 +/- 4.0 to 38.8 +/- 3.9 min (p < 0.05) and reduced the blood clearance rate of cortisol (BCR) from 31 +/- 3 to 15 +/- 4 L/h (p < 0.01).
Title: Carbenoxolone does not cause a syndrome of mineralocorticoid excess in sheep.
Name: Carbenoxolone

Sentece: The reduction in cortisol BCR was associated with reduction in cortisol secretion rate from 433 +/- 116 to 181 +/- 79 nmol/h (p < 0.01).
Title: Carbenoxolone does not cause a syndrome of mineralocorticoid excess in sheep.
Name: Carbenoxolone
